name: Advice From a Friend
description:
OCD is a disease frequently mis-portrayed in media. With frequent representations being either far too extreme or flat out lies. Advice From A Friend seeks to show what it actually feels like to live with OCD by following a young college graduate named Robin as she goes about her day. Talk to residents, complete OCD rituals, and just try to get through one very bad day.

  • Experience life with OCD in an accurate and heartbreaking way.
  • Complete real life OCD rituals ranging from checking door locks to compulsivehandwashing.
  • Develop muscle memory to simulate pattern thinking, similar to what OCD feels like.
  • Fully written out and linear story, taking place over one very hard day.
  • Talk to 6 unique and fully developed characters!
  • 5 Completely unique and interesting locations to explore!
  • Completely original pixel art!

Advice From A Friend was developed by two people, Ethan Duncan and Hayley Kocherhans. It was developed for EAE 3720 – Alternative Game Development at the University of Utah in the spring of 2021. Contact us at ethandprogrammer@gmail.com
